result.execSummary:
The defendant CAMERON D COCHERELL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant CAMERON D COCHERELL in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for CAMERON D COCHERELL.  Attorney Andreasen in court for State of Wisconsin. State-  amend count 1 to misd. poss. 961.41 (3g)(b).  Defendant will plea to count 1 and 2.  Count 1- 30 days jail $465.60.  Count 2- 90 days jail $465.60  conc. to each other cons. to any other sentence.  Count 3,4 dismissed but read in.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court colloquies the defendant.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and 2.  Count 1- 30 days jail $465.60.  Count 2- 90 days jail $465.60  conc. to each other cons. to any other sentence.  Count 3,4 dismissed but read in. 127 days credit. time served
